dmca.title: [ABUSE] DMSA Notice
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf
Of Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Friday, June 02, 2006 11:48 AM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [Fwd: [ABUSE] DMSA Notice]
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] DMSA Notice]


For your review.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

-------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] DMSA Notice
Date:         Fri, 02 Jun 2006 08:44:49 -0700
From:         Kortney <kortney@ephotique.com>
To:         <copyright@theplanet.com>, <abuse@theplanet.com>



June 2, 2006

*Sender Information*:

                       Ephotique
(dba: Eckert Photo Imaging)

                       Sent
by:  Kortney Eckert

                      1235
Orchard Glen Circle

                       Encinitas,
CA.  92024, USA

*Recipient Information*:
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc., *www.goldenlockss.com
*1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Dallas, TX 75207
United States
(214) 782-7802


Sent via email:

*The following is a DMCA* notice.
*

We have discovered the unauthorized use of sixteen (16) images, possibly
more, copyrighted by Ephotique (dba: Eckert Photo Imaging) on your
Goldies Sexy Avatars (_http://www.goldenlockss.com_ )  web site.

The following images located at
_http://www.goldenlockss.com/images/?CurrNum=50
__The image below is of an UNDERAGE model!

_

And the following images located at
_http://www.goldenlockss.com/150s/?CurrNum=125


_And the following images located at
_http://www.goldenlockss.com/150s/?CurrNum=250
_

These images were just on the first several pages, who knows how many
more there could be!



The images displayed above, from your site, were deliberately cropped to
remove our copyright notice.

The above shown images were believed to be originally taken from our
online portfolio with One Model Place.  As stated previously, *_ Our
copyright notice has been removed from the images posted on your site,
which violates the copyright law.
_*
Ephotique's copyrighted works which have been infringed can be found at
_http://www.onemodelplace.com/johne_ .

If you wish to examine such copyrighted works, you may do so by visiting
www.onemodelplace.com/johne. Once you enter the site, simply scroll down
the page and find the images you see above and click on the image, all
images have our copyright notice in either the bottom left or right and
corner of the image.

I have a good faith belief that the use of the Ephotique copyrighted
material in the manner complained of in this email is not authorized by
the copyright holder Ephotique, its agent, or the law. The information
in this notification is accurate. I swear under penalty of perjury that
I am authorized to act on behalf of Ephotique (dba: Eckert Photo
Imaging) the owner of the exclusive rights in the material which is
being infringed.

Ephotique (dba: Eckert Photo Imaging) is requiring either (1) the
immediate removal of each of the infringed images from your website, or
(2) by bringing each of the infringed images into copyright compliance
by replacing each of the infringed images with the original image
containing our copyright notice.

Please contact me if you have any questions about this notice.

Kortney Eckert
Ephotique (dba: Eckert Photo Imaging)
1235 Orchard Glen Circle
Encinitas, CA.  92024
_kortney@ephotique.com
_


------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------
* The *Online Copyright Infringement Liability Limitation Act*
(*OCILLA*), a portion of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act
<_http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act_> known
as *DMCA 512* or the *DMCA takedown* provisions, is a 1998
<_http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1998_>  US
<_http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_> law that provided a safe
harbor to online service providers
<_http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Online_service_provider_>  (OSPs,
including ISPs
<_http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_service_provider_> ) that
promptly take down content if someone alleges it infringes their
copyrights. Most are generally supportive of the act, although some
believe it has some problematic portions and is overused.
